definition: to cause to burn/to ignite/to detonate/a fuse

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil

sentences.english: The economic development that the bank helped spur has unleashed a wave of environmental woes.
sentences.chinese: 亚银协助亚洲经济快速发展，引爆一波环保灾难。

sentences.english: The performance is optimized by using a pyrotechnic igniter as described in the Igniter web page.
sentences.chinese: 性能优化，使用烟火点火器中所述的引爆器的网页。

sentences.english: The initiation process is re-corded by a high speed rotating camera.
sentences.chinese: 引爆过程用高速转镜相机记录。

sentences.english: I can rig it so it detonates on impact.
sentences.chinese: 我可以改装让炸弹立即引爆。

sentences.english: But Georgia banks blew themselves up with old-fashioned loans gone bad.
sentences.chinese: 但乔治亚州的银行却因老式贷款坏账而引爆自身。

sentences.english: Iran and Isreal are ready to explode any time.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗和以色列的冲突随时会引爆。

sentences.english: They detonated two blasts, which could be heard for miles around.
sentences.chinese: 他们引爆了身上的爆炸，这可能是听到英哩左右。

sentences.english: We find the village of Latifa littered with bomblets that haven't gone off yet.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现拉提法村布满未引爆的小炸弹。

sentences.english: He Junfeng above knelt down to give him upon his head, then blew up his house.
sentences.chinese: 贺俊峰上面跪下来给他磕了头，然后引爆了他的房子。

sentences.english: Shingyouji Temple is about 3 km away from the point of detonation.
sentences.chinese: 真行寺寺庙距离引爆原子弹的地方只有三公里。

sentences.english: Workers detonated the charges that collapsed the building.
sentences.chinese: 工人们引爆了爆破大楼的炸药。

sentences.english: The rubble, Zhong Xiaoxian etc. People cant find the fuse, unable to detonate.
sentences.chinese: 碎石瓦砾中，钟小娴等人找不到导火索，无法引爆。

sentences.english: Police believe he detonated the bomb.
sentences.chinese: 警方相信他引爆了炸弹。

sentences.english: The fuel is the basis of the single-event FAE or the thermobaric weapons.
sentences.chinese: 燃料是一次引爆型FAE或温压武器的基础。

sentences.english: The engineers detonated the explosives to make a tunnel through the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们引爆了炸药以建造穿山隧道。

sentences.english: Dan: Who cares? World War llI could start tomorrow. Right?
sentences.chinese: 管他呢，明天就将引爆“三战”了，对吗？

definition: to cause to explode/to fire/to set off
to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
to explode/spontaneous detonation/self-detonation/suicide bombing/to disclose private matters about oneself
to break out/to erupt/to explode/to burst out
